intro: Saussurea viridibracteata, commonly known as the green bract saussurea, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and herbaceous growth habit. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a dense inflorescence. It thrives in cold, arid environments and is adapted to rocky and alpine soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
